narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Great opportunity to explore a field of interest in depth
I learned a great deal about political philosophy, theories of democracies, and built on my knowledge from previous EPE seminars

Definitely learned a ton about how to take on a big research project, ask the right questions, find helpful resources, engage with a body of literature. A lot of the learning happens from making mistakes and realizing how to do it better the next time, but having a good advisor can also be helpful in this regard.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The course would benefit from a required meeting time once a week to help the department check in with students more regularly.
Great course- would love to meet professor in person though
It was phenomenal. Professor Kapustin is an excellent professor.
The senior writing workshops never really materialized this year -- I'm not sure if there's a more normal routine to meet, discuss, and review each other's work during a non-COVID semester.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)

Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Definitely- a great ending of my yale career

It is tough but rewarding to pursue an independent thesis in EPE -- I did most of the work for my project on a gap semester, which ended up being a great choice for me. If you're thinking about doing an independent thesis, be honest with yourself about how much time you are able/willing to put in to the project -- it will not be a fun experience if you aim too high and are unable to deliver! Choose an advisor who is excited about advising and invested in you and your project.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Professor Kapustin advised my thesis this semester.
